Text:
Cid has arrived in the royal capital of the Oriana
Kingdom, known as the kingdom of the arts.

While usually a popular sightseeing destination,
there isn't a tourist in sight now.

War could break out at any moment, and the locals are
understandably tense.

How the hell can those swine go around acting all
high and mighty?
It's all because of that patricidal princess.

Yeah, it's that rancid witch's fault everything's so
expensive! And that my mom's food tastes awful!
I hope she gets what's comin' to her.
Rose Oriana...

She's dead-set against marrying...which is fine in
and of itself.

It's the middle of the day, which kinda rules out an
aerial entrance... Suppose I'll just hop the gate.

Time for me to let the blinding speed I've carefully
honed shine... Here goes noth—
Master Sha—I mean, Cid!
I haven't seen you in so long!
Epsilon. Fancy meeting you here.
I know! So are you here about the matter in question?

Cid could say he is here to play piano at the wedding,
but decides it would be cooler if he plays along.

Yeah, that's right. And your timing couldn't be
better, Epsilon.
Oh, think nothing of it!

You gifted me with these abilities in anticipation of
moments like this, no?!

They are able to get into the castle thanks to
Epsilon's VIP status.

The two of them walk down one of its vaulted
corridors side-by-side.

In Oriana, anyone with recognizable artistic ability
is treated with respect, regardless of race or social
status.
That's how even I can enter the castle openly.

And I can tag along by playing the part of your star
pupil, huh?

Forgive me. I didn't mean to suggest that you were
not my true instructor...

(They're 99% slime...and she constantly corrects for
shifts in her center of gravity by fine-tuning her
magic control. Pointless efficiency that even accounts
for chaos theory. Talk about a waste of talent.)
Is there something wrong?
Just admiring the fruits of your efforts.
Oh, well I can still do much better.
Epsilon leans in close to Cid's ear and whispers.
The target is at large and under surveillance.
...I see.
(The target...?)
Our cover remains intact.
Once the opportunity arises, we will swoop in and—
Why, if it isn't the ravishing Lady Shiron.
Huh...?
Ah, Duke Asshat.

Will you be dazzling us with a performance at today's
luncheon?

Yes, that's right. I intend to play one of my new
compositions.

I can hardly wait to hear it. All of your songs are
so wonderfully avant-garde, after all.

My only wish is that my music will bring some comfort
to Princess Rose after the loss of her father...
Your kind words are appreciated.

...But I'm afraid that Rose is feeling unwell,
and will not be attending today's meal...
Hehehe...
I see...as her betrothed, you must be worried.

Why, would it not be my role as husband to
support the kingdom in my wife's stead while
she is indisposed?
Well said, Duke Asshat.
(Duke Perv Asshat...)

(Gotta hand it to him. He's like a textbook
villainous aristocrat in the flesh.)

(Guess the road to being a Named would be pretty
rough if you can't pull off these kinds of archetypes
like a natural, huh...)
By the way, who is this young fellow with you?
Huh?

Before you stands someone of great, sublime stature.
My one and only beloved pupil.
Well, well.
A pupil...?!
I never would have suspected...!

Well, we do try to keep our relationship out of the
public eye...

Forgive my asking, but has he obtained the proper
permit to enter the castle?
Is him being here as my attendant not good enough?

I must apologize yet again, but circumstances have
necessitated certain changes in procedure...
Oh, well in that case, we'll come back another—
No, that will not be necessary.
Huh...?

Having him play us a song will suffice. As you can
see, everyone here is dying to see what this
apprentice of yours can do.

(Talk about a curveball...even side characters can't
catch a break. Gotta respect his dedication to playing
the classic bad guy.)

(Maybe I'll step up my game as an extra who can play
a few notes on the piano...)
